content.p: The chaplains are independent, and their time is a gift to the University from their individual faith communities. Chaplains are here to support all students and staff of any faith or none. The faith and denominational labels given are only a guide, feel free to contact any of us! Chaplaincy roles Book an appointment For general enquiries please contact the Multifaith Coordinator. Laura Henderson (Multifaith Services Manager) Pronouns [She/Her] University Park laura.henderson@nottingham.ac.uk +44 (0)115 951 3931 +44 (0)7870 854634 Biographies and contact details for the Christian chaplains Biographies and contact details for the Jewish chaplains Biographies and contact details for the Muslim chaplains Biography and contact details for Humanist Chaplain Biography and contacts details for the Buddhist Chaplain Biography and contact details for Hindu Chaplain Assistant Chaplains, sometimes also known as Lay Chaplains, are active and regular practising members of their faith community. They will often come under the direct supervision of a university chaplain and part of their role may include supporting the chaplain with their work. Assistant chaplains are able to offer pastoral support but may refer to a chaplain for more complex faith questions. A29, Portland Building University of Nottingham University Park, Nottingham, NG7 2RD Tel: +44 (0)115 951 3931 Email: chaplains@nottingham.ac.uk
